newsitem.title: GERMANY: Luxembourg leader warns against EMU delay talk.
newsitem.headline: Luxembourg leader warns against EMU delay talk.

text.p: Luxembourg Prime Minister Jean-Claude Juncker warned German politicians on Monday that postponing the launch of the single European currency would have disastrous consequences for the German economy.
Juncker said he was concerned about comments from some German politicians who have openly contemplated a delay in European economic and monetary union (EMU).

Conservative Bavarian premier Edmund Stoiber has repeatedly said a delay would be better than a soft euro. Hamburg mayor Henning Voscherau, a Social Democrat, told Monday's Der Spiegel magazine that he could oppose EMU if the conditions were not right.
"The rejection front against the euro is getting a bit more ecumenical. This fills me with concern," Juncker, who holds the European Council's rotating presidency, told German Radio.

"Delay is out of the question. This would lead to a collapse in the German domestic economic situation because there would be revaluation pressure on the mark. Germany's export-driven upturn would collapse brutally," he said.

"People are doing a fair amount at the moment in Germany to talk down the euro. It would be better to approach the euro in a spirit of preparation," Juncker said. "This is the last great ambition of this century which we in Europe have to achieve."
